propertyDescriptions.electrophysiology-header: Header with instructions for the electrophysiology metadata.

electrophysiology-header.title: electrophysiology-header field schema
electrophysiology-header.description: electrophysiology-header field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

_ui._content:
Electrophysiology Metadata Template

The purpose of this template is to provide the metadata for about the electrophysiology data, if included in the dataset. Some metadata fields here are based on the brain imaging data structure (BIDS) specifications extension to microelectrode electrophysiology (under development).

Please note the pre-specified physical units for the quantitative fields.

This template is further divided into 4 different sections:

  1. Probe Metadata: This section provides metadata about the probes that record electrophysiological data. Probes here refer to physical devices used for recording. These could be acutely implanted or chronically implanted.
  2. Electrode Metadata: This section provides metadata about the electrodes associated with the probes defined above. Electrodes here are defined as the point of contact between the probe and the animal tissue.
  3. Channels Metadata: This section provides metadata about the channels of the recorded signals. These signals might be of neuronal origin (e.g. online filtered LFP) or generated by the recording setup (e.g. synchronization signals, behavioural signals, etc.). The channel type field is to be used to specify this. The channel unit field is mandatory, use the most appropriate selection (e.g. count unit, millivolt, etc). Use the value, “none of the above” if none of the listed units are applicable, and use the free text field at the end to specify and describe it.
  4. DAQ Metadata: This section is used to provide metadata about the data acquisition system setup used to record the electrophysiological data.
